text: thumb Tuwon shinkafa is a type of Nigerian and Niger dish from Niger and the northern part of Nigeria. It is a thick pudding prepared from a local rice or Maize or millet that is soft and sticky, and is usually served with different types of soups like Miyan kuka, Miyan kubewa, Miyan taushe. ==See also== * Nigerian cuisine ==References== Category:Rice dishes Category:Porridges Category:Nigerian cuisine
title: Tuwo shinkafa
